headline: Chile Relleno Casserole
description: This is a Mexican-style casserole made with hamburger and green chile peppers. It produces a much simpler version of chile rellenos, which are simply stuffed chile peppers.
name: Chile Relleno Casserole
recipeIngredient: 2 (4 ounce) cans whole green chile peppers, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine ground beef and onions and sauté for 5 to 10 minutes, or until browned; drain excess fat.

Arrange 1 can of chile peppers on the bottom of a 7x11-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with half cheese and top with meat mixture. Sprinkle meat mixture with remaining cheese, followed by next can of chile peppers.
In a medium bowl, combine eggs, flour, and milk, whisking until smooth. Pour this into the baking dish over chile peppers. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 to 50 minutes. Let cool for about 5 minutes before cutting.

review.reviewBody: YUM DELICIOUS!!
I made it, it was great! I seasoned the ground beef a little with cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, and of course salt and pepper. Thanks for posting this recipe.
This recipe is straight out of my 52-year-old Better Homes and Gardens Cookbook.
Always use this at the end of the year when the garden needs a good harvest. We freeze and eat them when the weather get cold. Yummy!
We loved this and so easy! Next time hot chilies!
yummy
We loved it! I did add garlic and taco seasoning to the ground beef as suggested, my dish was a square 10 × 10 and I needed 3 cans of the chilies. Baked for 40 minutes

I follow the recipe except I use roasted poblano peppers instead of canned green chiles and use shredded Chihuahua cheese instead of the one in the recipe. I have also tried it with sliced onion...soo good!!
Delicious and so easy to put together!

Excellent!!! I did as another reviewer and used a 9×13 dish added more cheese ( I used pepper Jack and a blend of 4 cheese mexican cheese), taco seasoning to the meat mixture and a lot more peppers! It's a keeper! Good for breakfast, lunch or dinner!
Friends loved it.
I made this exactly as written but used 1/2 & 1/2 and whole milk only because I didn’t have enough milk. It was absolutely perfect! Will make again!
I made this but used rotisserie chicken instead. Turned out really good, but seemed more like a brunch dish to me, not a dinner dish.
Fun, easy and veryy versatile
We are from new Mexico and this was a great reminder of the food we miss so much (with far less mess than chile rellenos!) Absolutely delightful!

Awesome!

I deviated a bit by using fresh chiles that I roasted here at home (used 2 Anaheim and 2 Poblano). I also added taco seasoning mix to the ground beef & onion mixture prior to assembling the dish. Other than that, I followed the recipe.

Turned out great! Will definitely make again...and again...and again.
We love this casserole. As requested, I'll be making this again!
Nice simple recipe, I added cumin for a bit of flavor and an extra layer of chiles! Good stuff! Thank you for the recipe!

i made this two nights ago and it was absolutely delicious and is being thrown into my dinner rotation. i doubled everything to make a larger casserole.

 the only things i'm going to change next time is swapping out canned peppers for fresh poblanos, and seasoning things a little differently. the canned peppers did have good flavor, but the texture was kinda off.

Used 2 fresh roasted Pablano Peppers.
 The rest was just as written and it was a hit! Topped with sour cream. Served with quacamole, chips and salad. Will definitely make this again! Thanks for sharing!!!

Loved this dish! I used 6 fresh poblano peppers in place of canned. Roasted peppers in the oven till charred, steamed in plastic bag for 20 minutes and removed the skin and seeds. Added some chili powder and cumin to season the chorizo as well as 1 pound of pulled pork mixed together. Had two guests for dinner who both loved this dish too! Will definitely make again.

This recipe as is is . I bought more peppers than it called for and used a smaller pan, still not enough peppers. 

Used all the comment suggestions like taco seasoning, garlic, chili sauce. 

At this point this particular recipe is useless.
I used fresh poblanos (about 7), no canned peppers were available. Good, but could use more spice. I thought it was a little bland. I will make it again.

I tweaked this recipe a bit, after reading all the reviews and it was EXCELLENT! I used ground chicken, 2 tbsp taco seasoning, 1tbsp cumin, 1 cup of salsa, 2 cloves of minced garlic, 3 eggs instead of 4, and 1 can each of green chilies and 1 can of jalepeno peppers. Honestly, is not much to look at but , it is so good...we ate 3/4 of it for the 2 of us! A keeper for sure.
It was so delicious!
Only thing I did different was add mushrooms and taco seasoning to the meat. I've made this dish three times now and it's definitely a favorite!!
I followed the recipe as instructed. Very easy to make. I made it for a birthday potluck at work. Everyone complemented me on how delicious it was. Will keep this recipe as a favorite.
I used chopped chilies instead of whole. Made it much easier to cut and serve

Oh my goodness, yummy! I could tell from reading the ingredients that it wouldn't have enough flavor for my family so I cooked 2 jalapeños and some onion with the meat first. Then I added the taco seasoning. Since I had a large can of whole green chilies I needed to use I prepared the casserole like a lasagna. After I put the egg mixture on top, I sprinkled garlic powder and red pepper flakes. The family went crazy! This was so so good. Thanks!

With the exception of adding cumin to the ground beef and the milk/egg mixture, I made the recipe as written. My husband and I loved it! It's cheesy, moist and delicious. If you like spicy food, you will need to add the spices that you like. It's great comfort food and I will recommend this recipe to others.

I made some changes to the recipe. Instead of hamburger I used Jimmy Dean's Chorizo. A one pound chub. It was on sale for $1.99, so a lot cheaper than hamburger. I also used two 7 oz cans of diced green chiles. First I sprayed a casserole dish with Pam spray. I spooned in one can of green chiles. Sauteed half a diced onion with some garlic. Cooked the chorizo with the onion and garlic, and added 1 1/2 cups of cooked rice to the mixture. Spooned half the mixture onto the green chiles, spread pepper jack cheese on top. Spooned the other half onto the cheese. Spread more cheese onto that. Put the other can of green chiles into a blender with 4 eggs, 1/4 cup of flour and 1 cup of milk. Blended on low for a minute then poured on top of the chorizo mixture. Put rest of the cheese on top. Baked at 350 for 50 minutes. Made some homemade refried beans for a side. That was a good dinner. Plus leftovers for work.
I substituted fresh chiles and roasted them in an skillet then took the skin off instead of using canned chiles

This was ok but the "breading" was too eggy. It had the consistency o scrambled eggs which just isn't right for a chile rellano casserole. We ended up eating it in tortillas. I would try a different recipe unless you want brunch in which case it needs more of the acrbled eggs.

I have made this several times. I like to cook the ground beef with rotel chile and seasons first. I also add black olives to the toppings because we like them. It is a good recipe, and sometimes we make it with more or less egg mixture, depending on our mood. 

It's one of my favorite dishes.

My Mom used to make a similar Casserole years ago without meat. She used to use a Red Salsa on top. Yesterday I used this recipe without the meat and I roasted my own Pasilla chilis (a bit more spicey). I layered with chilis, cut slices of monterey jack cheese, green chili salsa I made (tomatillos/can of green chilis/garlic blended in blender). I didn't put too much green salsa chili on each layer, I didn't want it to be too liquidy. My last layer was the green roasted pasilla chili, poured the egg/milk/flour mixture and topped with shredded (Mexican blend) cheese about 1 cup on top and more green salsa (about a cup). I made this for a Pot Luck and it was a huge hit. Everyone was full, because I came a bit late, but couldn't help themselves.

Super easy to make. Delicious with a little more seasoning (might try taco seasoning next time). But really good with out it. Used fresh chili peppers instead of canned. I couldn't find canned ones. Husband loved it but said it could use an extra egg.
Great recipe if your craving a chili rellano. I added some taco seasoning to the hamburger and it was a hit. A recipe we'll make more often.
This was a huge hit tonight with the family. However, I did take some other users advice and added a packet of taco seasoning. Definitely going to be a keeper.
Best tasting and easy compared to the labor intensive Mom's recipe.
I am on a low carb diet so I used heavy cream and almond flour still great.
I made this recipe last night. It turned out GREAT!!! Everyone loved it!

I have made this recipe many times...the first time I folded it exactly...since then I have always used either taco seasoned ground turkey, or taco seasoned ground beef. Everyone I make it for loves it and there are so many ways to change up the recipe...
I added mushrooms and diced garlic it was delicious I give it a 5....

I made two half batches of this, one with hamburger, one with diced cooked ham. I much prefer the one with the ham. I didn't use taco seasoning, as some have suggested, but just added cumin, garlic, chili seasoning and black pepper. Great on a cold fall night.
Very good added taco seasoning and fresh garlic to meat mixture. Used fresh roasted hatch chiles. Topped with homemade hatch chile salsa

Loved it!!! I made this with real Poblno chiles (5), ground turkey, seasoned with taco seasoning, corn meal instead of flour and used a packaged Mexican cheese mix (used the full package of 2% cheese). I also put in about 3 dashes of cholula hot sauce. It was amazing!!!

Delicious recipe except i added some flavor to the meat because of the reviews, and i didnt have taco seasoning so I added some onion,cilantro,some tomato bouillon(dont add much bouillon because it could make the meat salty)and a hint of garlic powder into the skillet. Instead of using canned chiles I used fresh chiles and follewed the instructions as HAMBONE! mentiones in the reviews. Over all my husband loved it and it will be a keeper.
Good, easy recipe. A little bland for our tastes also but a good start. Going to add taco seasoning to meat next time and use pepper jack cheese. Also used a 27oz can of chilies. Perfect!
My husband loves the real chile relleno and he liked this recipe. I thought it was great & easy to make.
Wonderfu recipe! Listened to other reviews and added taco seasoning and pork sausage also used Cojita cheese on the very top. My daughter loved it and so did my mom...a deffinate keeper!

I've made Chile Rellno Casserole for my own 60th b'day last year. It was gone in the first half hour. I DID NOT use canned whole green chiles!! That's just awful. I roasted 20 lbs of FRESH whole anaheim chiles. I did not use the ground beef. The real relleno is made with "cheese". There are some recipes that SHOULD NOT be altered. This is one of them. Especially when several of your guests are Hispanic. Using evaporated milk seems to work better then dairy whole milk.
Followed this recipe to the letter and it turned out to be very bland.

This recipe is very very easy to make, and I suppose for the effort involved, it is great. Since a majority of the ingredients are canned, it does have that canned, bland taste, which again, given the quick fix recipe, still comes out good. I think the cheese was waaaaay to much. I love cheese, but this was more like a cheese enchilada with chiles on the bottom.
Used chicken instead of beef, it was delicious!

Love this recipe! I do add some taco seasoning which is a nice addition and usually use egg whites with maybe just one egg for less cholesterol. Also, this can be made without the meat and is still very tasty!

I made this tonight...it is pretty good, I found that I needed to add salt and pepper...it is nothing like a chille relleno, but pretty good and a lot easier to make. I also reduced the milk to 1 cup. I will probably make this again
very delicious and eay to make,
Was ok at best...

great foundation recipe! I used left over steak and ground with spices and veggies. Also used poblano peppers, gave the dish a little kick! Also added a pinch of baking powder to flour to get a fluffy authentic batter.

I made this and replaced the beef w/ bacon that I diced and fried up quickly. I used 1 can diced green chiles and 1 can diced jalapenos because we like some heat. I served it for breakfast with toast and sliced tomatoes broiled w/ a little cheese on top. It was really good, but even BETTER later, reheated, between two slices of buttered toast as a sandwich. Maybe not traditional but one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had! I sliced the leftovers into 'sandwich size' and froze to have quick breakkies!

Thank you much for this recipe! I needed something with simple ingredients that I had on-hand. I actually used this with leftover chicken instead of beef. I wanted to be quick so I added 1 cup of salsa on top of the meat instead of onion. I used Chedder/Jack combo cheese. In addition to salt and pepper, I added 1 tsp. of sugar and 1/2 tsp. of cumin to the flour/egg mixture. I used diced green chiles and only used one 4 oz. can. I didn't want to use 2 in case I didn't like the recipe since I made so many changes. Well, it came out super tasty and I will make it again. There was a lot of juice from the salsa so I served with a slotted spoon.
Maybe it was our taste buds, but we really didn't care for this. I want to blame the egg. It just didn't taste right with the other ingredients.

I did a few things differently, but it was sooo fantastic, it was all gone very quickly. I added 2 cloves of garlic, roasted 4 chillies, peeled and seeded them, split them down the center and laid them flat in the dish. I decreased the amount of milk to 1 cup and used Monterey Jack cheese instead of Cheddar. I think next time I will try corn meal mix instead of plain flour. It really was fantastic. I will use this over and over again.
Quick and easy to make. Great taste ! Kids loved it too!

This doesn't taste like traditional chile rellenos, but it was a nice flavor. Instead of using canned chiles, I used freshly roasted and peeled chiles. They helped the flavor a lot, making the dish hotter.
I was a little disappointed with lack of flavor in this recipe. I guess I was expecting it to taste a lot like chile rellenos, but it came nowhere near it.

This is sooooo good! For the milk, I used half milk, half heavy whipping cream to add a little thickness. I cooked the meat with 1/2 packet of taco seasoning as some of the other reviewers said to do. I also put shredded cheddar and a little chili powder on the top the last 10 minutes and it made it more appealing to the eye and added a little crunch. YUM!

This is sooooo good! For the milk, I used half milk, half heavy whipping cream to add a little thickness. I cooked the meat with 1/2 packet of taco seasoning as some of the other reviewers said to do. I also put shredded cheddar and a little chili powder on the top the last 10 minutes and it made it more appealing to the eye and added a little crunch. YUM!

Husband said in order for this to be a 5-star recipe, it needs "crispiness." That's no fault of the recipe, though. Maybe if I'd broiled it after it was done baking, it would have been 5-stars for him! I rate it 5-stars, but with a few modifications. 1.) I baked this in a 13x9 inch pan and used 4 cans of whole chile peppers (opened them up flat) and one 12 ounce can of evaporated milk instead of plain milk; 2.) I dumped two small cans of tomato sauce over the top once it was done, then baked another five minutes to heat the sauce through; 3.) since I used a bigger pan, I used another 1/2 cup of cheese (as if I need an excuse to use more cheese!). Overall a great recipe! I will make this again!

I used what I had- 2 lg cans chopped green peppers, and MJ cheese. Followed the recipe and it turned out great. Served with Green Salsa for the extra kick. I made Camp Cornbread and served with stuffed jalapenos. It was a very nice meal. Thanks for the recipe!

This could also be made vegetarian by substituting either Morningstar Farms Veggie Crumbles or the Boca version for ground beef. Gardenburger has a black bean chipotle burger that could probably be either cut up or crumbled into this casserole as a ground-beef substitute. I've got a vegetarian in the house, so I think about these things.

If your looking for something with a little spice to it, you'll need to add more chilies or even chopped jalapenos. I add more green chilies, onion and garlic so that the kids will eat it then my husband and me top it off with hot salsa.

I gave this recipe 4 stars because it needs triple the amount of chiles it calls for. The first time I made this with the 2 cans of chiles it was too cheesy and there weren't enough chiles. Now I always use 5 or 6 - 4oz cans. With more chiles this recipe is awesome!
My husband and I loved this recipe. As suggested in other reviews, I also added taco seasoning to the meat and used 2-7oz. cans of peppers. Next time I may add more peppers!! Great recipe...thanks.

At the last football game tailgate party, the theme was mexican food. I knew I couldn't take chile rellenos because they'd get too greasy. My husband grows anaheim peppers, so I picked them fresh, blistered and peeled them and made this recipe. I made four times the recipe, kept it hot in a chafing dish and it was a huge hit. Nothing was left after about 2 hours because the college frat boys kept going back for seconds!
YUM!The base was bland, I will add seasoning next time.I roasted fresh green chilis from the garden instead of canned.There were no leftovers,we will definately keep this recipe!

I don't know if it's because I live in high altitude and/or if it's because I used skim milk, but it would not cook in the center. I cooked it at 375 for over an hour and it still would not. I finally took it out when the eggs were cooked, but the milk was a puddle in the center, scooped out the liquid and put some heated enchilada sauce on it to save it. I will try a bigger dish next time and less milk. It was very good, other than the liquid fiasco, which also made it look unappetizing. I also added hot sauce and hot spices to the meat and onions.

The chile/cheese/egg part was ok, kind of like a spicy quiche filling, but the combination of the custardy part and the chunks of ground beef was downright bizarre. It tasted weird but kind of ok the first night, but the leftovers were completely gross. I do not recommend this at all.
it was like a version of the bacon cheeseburger upside down pizza

This recipe was very easy to make. I added the taco seasoning that everyone suggested and that made it very good. My husband and I absolutely love it. My kids are picky eaters so they didn't care for it. I would recomend it though. Thanks for the recipe. :)

I think I did something wrong, though I can't imagine what. It was bland and VERY greasy. Probably won't try this again - I'll look for another recipe for something similar. To me it really wasn't even worth tweaking.

SO, SO =-(
For a traditional taste & better visuals:
Break up a 14.5oz can of Mexican Style Stewed tomatoes w/fork and empty into the baking dish.
I used 6 Broiled/peeled/seeded Poblano peppers. Added garlic, oregano, salt & pepper to stuffing, carefully stuffed the peppers, placed on the tomato sauce.
In a bowl Whisk: 6 eggs, 1/3C flour, 1ts B.Powder & Pinch of salt, and pour over the sauce/peppers, sprinkle w/1C of shredded cheese and bake. GORGEOUS DISH!
Very good! Added extra cheese and seasoned the meat before it went into the oven, just before it was done i added cheese to the top and let it melt.

I'm not sure if anyone mentioned this yet. So here goes!

Buy fresh greenchiles, anaheim will do- But Hatch are best.. Roast them in your oven broiler till they blister, turning to get all sides even as possible. Remove and place in a brown grocery bag, with the top folded over for 5 or so minutes. Peel stem and seed. 

The other tip is to combine your ground beef with an equal ammount of PORK CHIORIZO. Brown them together. Make sure you cook thoroghly. Drain grease and continue with original recipe.

I also replace a small (1/3 portion) of the flour measure for the casserole "glue" with yellow corn meal, and add a few shakes of any mexican brand or tabaso type sauce to the batter.

Fight Night Favorite!

This definately was not like the restaurant but it was enough to satisfy the craving. I think I added more beef and extra chiles. I can imagine that without the extra beef it would have been breakfasty, but this was meaty and I will deifnately make again.

I gave this 5 out of 5 because I tinkered quite a bit with the base recipe.

I used 6 cans of chiles, 1.5 lbs of taco seasoned ground beef, I layered corn tortillas on the bottom & top, used queso blanco cheese instead of cheddar, added a layer of sliced jalapenos, and a can of red enchalada sauce poured over the top during the last 10 minutes of cooking.

It turned out quite tasty, and we were very pleased with the result.
Husband loved it. I used 4 cans of green chilies, 4 cups of cheese and a 9x13 pan.

Great recipe. Love that it's simple! After reading some of the reviews I decided to add a package of taco seasoning to the meat and onions but *yikes* I didn't have any. I decided to use the Taco Seasoning I from this website. I browned the meat, added the onion, then simmered for 20 min with 2 T of taco seasoning and half cup of water. I used FOUR cans of whole chiles (because one wasn't enough to make a full layer) and 3 cups of cheese. I used two cans for the first layer (sliced in half and spread out), then 1.5 cup cheese, meat mixture,1.5 cup cheese, 2 more cans of chiles, and egg mixture as directed. I'm so glad I added extra cheese. It was an attractive casserole and I think I'll bring it to my next potluck. My husband and I liked it a lot but I think I might add diced chiles to the meat mixture so make it hotter. Served with Spanish rice and Tapatio sauce & sour cream on the side. I'll give it 5 stars when I can make it hotter.

When I first viewed this recipe I wasn't too sure about it because it seemed too bland. But I tried it anyway and added to it. I added taco seasoning and minced garlic to my ground beef along with the onion. 
 My family loved it! I would recommend this recipe but know that you will need to add some spices to suit your taste.
This was excellent! My husband loved it and went back for seconds. All the ingredients really compliment each other. This is on my regular list of dishes for sure.
its a good recipe, the only thing was that i didnt care for the meat mixture and I would add more chiles and cheese to this recipe. But otherwise I like it .
Easy to prepare. Family gave it 4 thumbs up.

I have been using a version of this recipe for years. For the milk I use a 14 oz can of evap. milk only. I live alone so I make the casserole in mini-loaf pans and freeze, then thaw and heat when I want it later.

I was worried, but this turned out great! Made it the night before, then put it in the oven when we got home. Substituted eggs with Egg Beaters and added garlic and onion powder, paprika, and parsley. This is good for brunch or dinner. We even had it cold the next morning.
we had white rice with this and it was a great dish! Maybe some fresh diced tomatoes on top after it's finished baking would add just that perfect touch...
Made it the first time per the recipe and it wasn't good. Used chorizo in place of the beef the second time and it wasn't too much better. Giving up on this one.

Just looking at this recipe, I could tell it would be WAY too bland for our tastes, as other reviewers noted. To liven it up and make it a 5* recipe, add a packet of taco seasoning, 2 tsp fresh garlic, a Tbsp of chile sauce, and some black pepper. I also used monterey-jack cheese and added chili powder to the top. Excellent with changes!

I make this almost once a season for a ladies church brunch. Lots of compliments! I think it would be easier with chopped chiles and the dry ingredients jumbled together then have the egg mixture poured on top.
This recipe was very good with the addition of taco seasoning. The real fresh roasted green chilis from the great southwest are a must instead of canned.
